column1: sprays the first one wide outside off, it's called so New Zealand off the mark
short of a length outside off, 138kph, driven square off the back foot and finds point
fuller, straighter, angled in at middle and leg, takes the pad to the leg side
good length at off stump, defended
a touch fuller, Brownlie pushes at it and the ball runs off a thick inside half of the bat through square leg
adjusts his line straightaway to the left angled, angled across outside off, left alone and decent carry from a good length to de Kock
pushed across a little wider, Latham can watch this one settle in the keeper's gloves. A steady start from Morris. Not much pace in the pitch at first sight
creates some uncertainty first ball, Brownlie making a late decision to leave this delivery outside off and it takes the toe end of the bat...bobbles towards slip
fuller, wide outside off but he gets away with it
short of a length, worked from outside off into the leg side
the bottom hand comes into play again as he shovels this from outside off, was just short of a length, into midwicket
a big leading edge, once again closing the face, this time the ball is even wider outside off, it flies in the air towards third man but lands short
good delivery, full at off stump, just a hint of swing as Latham defends on the front foot to cover
full outside off, 139kph, gets onto the front foot and drives to mid-off
pushes a full delivery back down the pitch, Morris sticks out his right hand to gather it and Brownlie has to swiftly make sure he gets back in his crease
brilliant fielding, top support for the bowler...was a loose delivery, short and wide, Brownlie latched on with a back-foot square drive but it's intercepted at cover
gets this one through the field, though, as Morris gets a little too full and straight, flicked strongly in front of square
back outside off, on a good length, Brownlie caught a little back in the crease as he forces to the leg side
finds the gap again, this time through the off side, as he strides forward into a full delivery outside off and drives delightfully between cover and mid-off
angled in full at middle and leg, clips it through midwicket so he's off the mark
back of a length at off stump, 138kph, defended at the top of the bounce to cover
oh dear! Latham's problems continue. Slipped onto the pads by Parnell, but Latham clips it straight to square leg. That's a soft dismissal and, now, serious questions will start being asked
full outside off, 136kph, left alone
edged! But short of second slip. The slowness of the pitch helped Williamson. It was short of a length, Williamson prodded a little and it but the ball dies off the edge
this time it finds a thick inside edge as he defends a short-of-a-length ball
back of a length at off stump, defended to the on side
fuller, straight, clipped to midwicket and can't quite find the gap
punches this straighter, finds mid-on
hint of seam movement as this nips into the pads, deflects behind square
uncertainty from Williamson as he gets an inside edge to a full delivery at middle and off, that's a good length for Pretorius
defended into the leg side...tidy opening over
full, outside off, giving the ball every change to swing, left alone
tight run, but he's safe...pushes a full ball just straight of mid-off and he scampers off
good length outside off, pushed towards mid-off where it's de Villiers in action again. Simple piece of work this time
short outside off, he drags it through the leg side wide of mid-on but doesn't have enough to reach the longer boundaries at Hagley
short of a length, straighter, worked to square leg
back of a length outside off, defended with an open face to backward point
punched off the back foot towards cover
fuller at middle and off, squeezed through square leg
chops away a full delivery from outside off, slightly dangerous as he could drag it on, but dabs it wide of the lone slip
this jags back off the seam from a good length, takes an inside edge into the pads...that moved quite a lot
lovely piece of timing, that's classy...stands tall and punches a back-of-a-length delivery through the covers. Textbook Kane
returns to a fuller length, at the stumps, he pushes forward and it runs to short fine leg off a thickish inside edge
and now seam movement for him as well, nips back from a length, Brownlie takes his bottom hand off the back as he's cramped for room
another good-looking drive, on the up between cover and mid-off. Wasn't a bad delivery
a short ball, the first of the day, comes fairly slowly off the surface and it's comfortably avoided
gets inside the line and clips this off his hip wide of short fine leg, that races away...the line a fractionally wrong from Morris, too straight
another short ball, more effort in that one, 142kph, good line just outside off and it followed Brownlie a touch as he dropped his hands
and now he slashes firmly square of the wicket, offered some width and he threw everything at that. Was in the air for a while, but flew wide of backward point
full at off stump, 124kph, pushed back to the bowler
drags the length back a little, clipped to deep square leg
full outside off, a good channel, Brownlie opens the face and defends to backward point
driven to mid-off
a short ball, at the body, Brownlie swivels neatly on a pull and keeps the ball down towards deep square
gets forward, defends to the off side
driven on the up to cover
full, wider outside off, driven square to backward point
another short ball, it's outside off, but Brownlie is able to get over the top of it and pull down, rather than up as he did in Hamilton
full outside off, hint of shape in at Williamson, defended on the front foot
a short delivery outside off, Williamson jumps a little and punches into the off side
a fuller delivery to end the over, driven to mid-on
what timing he's got in that, was back-of-a-length at off stump, he punched it straight down the ground and it scoots away
fuller, angled into the pads, clipped to deep square leg
he also works to the leg side, but picks out midwicket
pulls the length back, finds midwicket again
this time he threads the gap, flicks the wrists at a full delivery around off stump and sends it wide of midwicket
tries something more expansive, a somewhat ungainly heave a full delivery and mistimes towards mid-on
on a length at off stump, pushed to the covers
tossed up, it's a full toss, bunted to long-on
lovely delivery, full, just outside off, turns a fraction to beat the outside edge
dragged down short, Williamson pulls but finds midwicket
nice touch from KW as he paddle-sweeps this through short fine leg, a good chance by Duminy around the rope
short, flatter, outside off, worked to the leg side
full, angled in at off stump, 125kph, pushed firmly to mid-on
drives straighter this time, clatters into Pretorius' shins and rebounds to the leg side
a short delivery, pulled through square leg
another short one, gets over the top and places to deep square
angled into the pads, clipped behind square

he's gone now! Another 30-odd and out for Brownlie. A full, straight delivery which he plays around. It did nip back, but he didn't ponder the review. Probably clipping leg stump. Well, the replay says it's missing leg stump by quite a bit! Gripped more off the pitch than it looked first up
gets forward and works into the leg side
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
squeezes a full, straight delivery through the leg side
opens his stance a touch as he drives down the ground to long-off
good length, brings Taylor forward, he defends
he gets across the crease, this is a googly, a jabby defensive shot to the leg side
starts on a good length outside off, opens the face and guides to third man
angling in at off stump, defended to mid-off...Phehlukwayo will be looking to get the ball to grip like Pretorius
he's across the crease, plays with a straight bat towards mid-on and judges a sharp single well
fuller at the stumps, flicked to deep square leg
dragged down short, 131kph, pulled deep into the leg side
back of a length, takes the thigh pad to the leg side
goes down early and dab-sweeps a full delivery through short fine-leg
almost drove that cover, Tahir nearly did him in the flight...he opened his stance to drive, wasn't quite to the pitch but was able to keep it down in front of short cover
worked down the ground
another sweep from Taylor, from around middle stump, out to deep backward square
full at off stump, driven to long-off
uses his feet, doesn't get to the pitch but is able to nudge down to long-on
slips into the pads and that's neatly deflected to fine leg with a little turn of the wrists
back outside off, defended behind point
full outside off, driven firmly to the covers
good length at off stump, Taylor is across the crease and defends
works this off the stumps behind square on the leg side
short delivery around middle and leg, takes a hint of top edge as he pulls but is safely to long leg
moves to leg a little to open up the off side but finds cover
fuller on middle and leg, tapped to the leg side
reaches forward and drives to the bowler
a googly, defended on the front foot with bat and pad together
uses his feet, makes this into a full toss and drives to long-off
stretches forward and eases this down the ground. Careful stuff from this pair at the moment
back of a length outside off, 131kph, worked into the leg side
fuller, at the stumps, forced to midwicket with a straight bat
flicked off the pads to long leg
a short delivery at off stump, 132kph, pulled without much timing to deep square
fuller outside off, he walks into this defensive shot which runs to backward point
tries to break free and is successful, lofts a full delivery in the air over wide mid-on, perhaps didn't completely middle it but was struck well enough and easily reaches the rope
comes down the pitch then flicks a full delivery to long-on
plays back to a slightly short delivery and punches down the ground
takes advantage of a delivery tossed wider, Taylor plays a flat-bat drive which finds the gap through the off side
and, again, uses his feet, this time clips to midwicket

almost threads the off side again, but Phehlukwayo saves him (partly, at least) with a good diving save at cover to cut off another strong drive from Taylor. There's a second run as the back-up fielder, du Plessis, slips
eased down the ground, smart batting by this pair against the leg spin
good length, angled into the pads, turned down to fine leg
bouncer at off stump, keeps the pull down, Tahir does the trademark swivel and throw after running to his left at long leg
full and angled in at off stump, pushes is nervously to midwicket. Slight shape in there
full at middle stump, plays across the line to flick it straight to square leg
full at middle, and once again he reaches out way in front of his pads, pokes at it and it flies a couple of yards past short midwicket
sweet. Pulls the momentum back. Full at leg stump, backs away slightly and offers the full face as he lifts it over mid-on
full outside off, shuffles across to get behind the line and defend
a bouncer at leg stump, he shuffles across again but has to sway away
back of a length outside off, no feet, pokes at it, beaten on the outside edge
good length, angled across into the corridor, front foot defence
good length outside off, pushes it past Parnell and takes off, Williamson a bit reluctant to respond as the bowler is sprawled across the floor in front of him, no worries in the end
bouncer at middle stump, shapes to hook, but lets it go last minute, that flew at him
back of a length in the corridor, dabs it down to third man
good length at off stump, hangs back and turns it to square leg using his wrists
back of a length at off stump, backs away and cuts it straight to point
short and angled down leg, but he doesn't get a lot on his pull shot and long leg cuts it off
full at leg stump, looks for the flick but it raps him on the pads. He's falling over slightly here, doesn't look settled
full at leg stump, times the cover drive nicely, but it's straight at the fielder
short at off stump, pushes back and short-arm-jabs it to square leg. Bit of hesitation with the running, but they're through safely once more
full outside off, leans into the cover drive and gets it past short extra cover this time
full at off stump, looks to punch this through the leg side, checks his shot and gets a thick outside edge past point
good length, angled across from off stump, defended off the front foot
back of a length at middle, pushed to deep square off the back foot
bouncer down the leg side, sails harmlessly over the attempted pull
short at middle, full control of the pull shot, hits it straight to deep square
short at middle, shapes up nicely and slaps this between fine leg and deep square
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot
good length, angled in at off stump, pushed feebly to short midwicket
good length at middle stump, gives him the charge and chips it inside-out to mid-off's left
short at middle, wants to pummel this pull shot, no timing, slight top edge to fine leg
good length, angled in at the thigh, gets just enough as he tickles it fine
short outside off, gets on top and keeps the pull down to find the gap between short midwicket and square leg
back of a length at middle, glances it to square leg to bring up yet another solid fifty at No. 3
back of a length at middle, pushed to deep square off his hips
good length outside off, pushes forward and opens the face to run it down
good length at off stump, front foot block
short and slightly wide, gets a lot of bat on the cut, but it's straight at point who fumbles
full outside off, punched uppishly between Taylor and mid-off
good length at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
fired down the leg side at a good length
tosses it up outside off, steps out and jams it to cover
googly tossed up at off stump, driven to covers
full at middle stump, punched to long-on
good length on the pads, hangs back and pushes it to deep square
googly, good length at off stump, gives him the charge, doesn't get to the pitch, pushes at it with the wrists and the inside edge catches the pads and, luckily for him, doesn't carry to leg slip
115 kph, slower ball, full outside off, draws him forward and he can only bunt it to covers
back of a length in the corridor, gets on top of the bounce and turns it to third man
back of a length at middle, glanced fine off the hips
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
bouncer outside off, it's still climbing at him as he goes for the hook, inside edge on to the back pad
back of a length at middle, turned to deep square leg
tossed up at middle, punched firmly to long-on
good length, fired into the pads, flicked to spinner square leg
tossed up on middle, gets under it and chips it nicely over Tahir. If I knew any golf, I'd have a better description for that
full and flat on the pads, pushed to midwicket's right
good length at off stump, waits for it to turn and pushes it past short third man. That one sat up slowly after pitching
good length at off stump, looked like a slider, pushed back to Tahir
full at off stump, punched past mid-on who is well inside
short and wide, chopped to third man's right
good length at off stump, turns it into the leg side using his wrists
back of a length outside off, opens the face, runs it down to third man
short and wide, cuts it past backward point on the bounce and that's 100 for the third wicket between these two
short and wide, cuts it to third man's right once more and comes back for a tight second...it's been reviewed, but he's well in
full at leg stump, steps out and chips it over midwicket into the larger side of the ground
oh dear, he's thrown it away. This one is tossed up at off stump, he wants to go for the same gap behind midwicket, but miscues the sweep and it's straight to long-on
good length at leg stump, turned down to fine leg
googly outside off, pushes forward and gets the inside half of the bat to short fine
googly, short and wide, waits for it and cuts it past point and that's 6,000 ODI runs for Taylor along with his 33rd ODI fifty
back of a length outside off, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
back of a length outside off, times a back foot square drive sweetly but it's straight to third man
short outside off, defended to point off the back foot
bouncer at off stump, keeps the hook down and gets it past square leg
good length outside off, turned to square leg off the front
back of a length outside off, climbs on him as he jumps to defend this
good length at off stump, leans forward and turns it into the leg side with soft hands
back of a length in the corridor, tries to push it into the offisde, is slightly late on it and it lands near his front foot
back of a length at middle, pushed to midwicket
120 kph, rolls his finger on the short ball outside off, it sat up nicely, he picked it too...but he's cut it straight to Duminy at point. Are the wheels coming off?
good length at off stump, front foot defence
full at leg stump, flicks it to deep square leg's right
short outside off, pulled to square leg on the bounce. He's getting on top of these shots, but there isn't a lot of pace in the wicket on the short ones
full and sliding down the leg, flicked to fine leg
good length at off stump, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
good length, angled across him, but he cuts it down and whips it on the up. One bounce to AB at mid-on
back of a length at middle, walks across the stumps and turns it square to Tahir's right at fine leg
back of a length at off, pulled to deep square
full outside off, punched back to the bowler off the front foot
back of a length, angled in at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length outside off, pushes it into the off side with soft hands
short at off stump, miscues the pull shot this time but square leg, who has been there all day is suddenly back and so he's safe
back of a length, slides down the leg side
good length outside off, pushed past backward point
good length outside off, pushed to mid-off
back of a length, turning in at middle, pushed into the leg side off the back foot
good length at middle, stays back in the creases and punches it to long-on

short and wide, chops hard at it, QDK drops this very thick inside edge as he's jumping. Sharp turn and bounce, cut out the room completely and caught the edge, no chance any keeper would have taken that
good length outside off, dropped with soft hands towards short third man
back of a length at middle, pulled to deep midwicket's right
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper
good length outside off, beats him on the outside edge as he tries to run it down. Was expecting that cutter to deviate away, but it slid straight through
good length outside off, pushes off the front foot, inside edge onto the pads
good length, angling in at middle, turned down to fine leg
good length outside off, pushed to point off the front foot
short at leg stump, pulled nicely, straight to fine leg
good length outside off, tries to slap it on the up, under-edges it into the pitch

good length outside off, turns back in and catches him on the pads, massive appeal from Duminy but called not-out...and it's been reviewed...front foot looks fine. No inside edge, confirms hotspot. Impact in line...umpire's call it remains. Just about clipping the leg stump.
tossed up at good length outside off, turned into the leg side using his wrists
fired into the blockhole at middle, jammed back to the bowler
good length at middle, steps out and punches it to long-oon
short and wide, cut away to a very square sweeper cover
short and wide, slappes aerially between backward point and short third
good length outside off, pushed off the front foot to point
good length at middle, turns it to fine leg
full outside off, driven to mid-off
good length at off stump, leans forward and punches it past the bowler's right on the up
back of a length, angled in at the pads, flicks it to fine leg
back of a length outside off, climbs on him as he tries to run it down, hits the shoulder of the bat and flies towards point, but lands safely
good length at middle, gives him the charge, doesn't get to the pitch and just about shovels it to long-on
good length outside off, plays it to long-on with the turn
good length, pushed flat at off stump, hurries him and cramps his cut, but he gets it past point
tossed up at middle, flicked to midwicket who puts in a dive to his left stop the single
good length at middle, pushed to deep midwicket
good length at off stump, front foot defence
good length at off stump, pushed off the front foot, back to the bowler
full and angled into the pads, head falls to much towards the off side as this catches his attempted flick on the pads
back of a length outside off, chopped to third man
back of a length, angled across, inside half of the bat on his attempted cut and it goes straight to point
goes around the wicket, back of a length outside off, punches on the up to point
good length outside off, swipes across the line but mid-on can cut that off to his left
full outside off, driven gloriously to sweeper cover's left. Great balance
pushed full at middle stump, flicks it to deep midwicket
googly, good length at off stump, turns it behind square off the front foot
googly pitched short outside off, gets an under edge onto QDK's pads as he goes for the cut
full at the pads, pushed to midwicket
good length at middle, punched on the up past midwicket, was looking for two but Neesham slips
superb yorker, follows him right down the leg side and de Kock has to take three steps to his left before putting in a dive as this slides under Taylor's bat
122 kph, slower ball, good length outside off, gets on one knee and drags a sweep down to fine leg
whew! Short at middle, leans back and slaps it right off the middle and it flies to the square leg boundary with what another Indian commentator would say is the speed of a certain kind of ammunition
back of a length outside off, chopped to sweeper cover off the back foot
full outside off, stretches out and drives it straight to cover
in the blockhole at middle stump, gets the bat down and respectfully bunts it into the off side
googly tossed up at off stump, clears the front foot and lifts this over the bowler classily
full outside off from around the wicket, gets down on one knee and sweeps it to deep midwicket's right
fired down the leg side at a good length
good length, flighted at middle stump, he's through his slog early and the bat turns. Rolls to deep square leg
good length and spinning away from outside off, square drive on the up to deep point
full at off stump, flicked to deep square leg
googly, good length outside off, uses his wrists, uses the spin, gets a single through square leg off the front foot
bouncer at middle stump, crouches slightly to create room in front of his head, but he's gone too far down and misses the pull
full at middle, gets his bat down on it rapidly and slams it past Neesham's head, straight to long-on
good length outside off, pulled off the front foot across the line to long-on
135 kph, full nothing delivery on the pads, good bat speed again, goes for the whip, turns it fine
goes for the yorker, misses line and length with a full toss down leg
slower bouncer outside off, Taylor is through with the pull shot very early
good length at middle, swipes across the line, fine leg runs to his left and tumbles to cut it off
low full toss on the pads, punched to long-on's left
yorker right in at middle stump, digs it out, rolls slowly towards the bowler, who can't beat Taylor's sprint even though he hits direct with an underarm flick
full outside off, nice bit of room, but he smashes it straight to long-off
fired in full at off stump, thumped down to long-on
yorker outside off, he shuffles across and gets low to try and paddle this fine, but he inside edges it onto the pads
full at middle stump, drives aerially but can't get power or height, couple of bounces to long-on
yorker outside off, dug out to point to bring up his third ODI fifty
slower ball, misses his length outside off, flays it off the front foot, three bounces at knee height and into the cover boundary
full outside off, drives it to sweeper's right and wants two straight away...fielder is off balance as he runs across and throws
slower bouncer, picks it and waits, but he can't get power on this pull shot
full outside off, driven to cover who chooses not to shy at the stumps despite getting it on a nice bounce
slower short one again, this time he waits and goes for the option that will give him more power - a cut over point
low full toss at middle, pumped out to deep midwicket, should have had more with that ball
yorker outside off, shuffles across, cramps himself and digs it out to third man
shapes up for a paddle sweep, adjusts and slices this good length ball outside off to third man
dropped to rapturous applause from the crowd! It's Faf at deep midiwicket. Neesham backs away deep in his crease and slogs the length ball aerially, Faf runs in and grasses it as he's falling forward
low full toss at off stump, gets low to sweep it, inside edge onto pad and it crawls into the square leg region where the fielder is at the boundary
yorker at leg stump, turns it away between fine leg and deep square
slower bouncer outside off, it's so short that it looops down on Taylor who waits and can't connect the cut shot this time
overpitched outside off from around the wicket, uses the angle to whip it between deep midwicket and long-on
back of a length, slower ball outside off, gets deep and butchers it flat-batted it on the up, straight to long-off
good length at off stump, slogs it, doesn't quite connect, straight to deep square
back of a length outside off, hangs back and waits for it, but pulls straight to long-on
97 kph, slower ball, short and wide, cut on the bounce to point
generous full toss outside off, hits it straight to cover
117 kph, slower ball, full outside off, wants to open the face and ramp it past de Kock and is beaten. Tries to scamper for a run in panic after, sent back
back of a length at off stump, stays still this time, clears the front foot, punches it over the non-striker
good length slower ball at middle, slogged out to deep midwicket

full outside off, walks across and nails the slog. It's gone flat and Miller has taken a stunning catch diving to his right...but he's fallen and slides towards the boundary...and uses his core strength to flick it back into play to save the bondary
full toss outside off, and he slaps it past cover to go past Nathan Astle's 16 ODI centuries and smashes the air with his bat...good anchor innings from Taylor, and NZ have got par here
full at off stump, defended
back of a length outside off, decent carry through to the keeper
fuller, Amla doesn't move his feet much but throws his hands through a drive and finds mid-off
full, at middle and off, just a small hint of swing, again he drives to mid-off
touch wider, too full, this time Amla drives through the off side, beating the man at cover
straightens his line, and pulls the length back, it's at middle and off, defended to the on side
starts off back of a length, punched off the back foot to cover
fuller, de Kock comes onto the front and plays a nicely-timed push through the covers...not flourish, just a punch
plays square off the back foot towards point
short outside off, he goes for the cut but it comes off the bottom edge into the pitch
gets onto the front foot, drives on the up to short cover
loses his line, pushed outside leg stump, but it only costs a single as de Kock flicks, one bounce, to long leg
slashed square but picks out point
fuller outside off, driven to mid-off
big appeal for lbw as de Kock plays across this. Paul Reiffel says not out. Did it pitch outside leg? Straightened a touch. No review. Replay shows it pitched outside leg
poor ball, full toss outside leg stump and this time de Kock finds the gap as he flicks it sweetly behind square
beats him with a very full one outside off, basically a yorker which de Kock played over the top of
given a hint of width and takes advantage, throws his hands through a cover drive which skips away to the boundary
back of a length outside off, a lovely piece of timing from Amla as he punches square off the back foot
returns to off stump, back of a length, defended

and he threads the off-side gap again, this time with the power for a boundary...just a smidgen of width from Boult, short of a length outside off, Amla rocks back and drives elegantly square off the back foot
back of a length outside off, the angle brings it in to Amla and it keeps on coming but wide enough to leave
defended off the inside of the bat, down by his feet
full and straight, played back to the bowler
short of a length, nips back at the left hander, takes him high above the pads
good length at middle and off, 115kph slower ball, defended to point...was a cutter, he bowled them superbly in Hamilton
full, hint of swing, de Kock slices across it a little as he aims to drive and the ball squirts off a thick outside edge, along the ground to third man
given lbw! Late swing for Southee. Full, straight, angled in from wide on the crease, then straightened very late on Amla, caught him right in front on the back pad. That's a lovely delivery
full at off stump, giving it the chance to move late, driven to mid-off
full at off stump, 138kph, pushed towards mid-off
that's top class...full outside off, but not a full half-volley, de Kock strides forward and drives on the up square through the covers
back of a length at off stump, 137kph, played with an angled face to backward point
a short ball, well-directed over middle and off, de Kock pulls through square leg
short of a length, on middle, du Plessis plays off the back foot to the leg side
pushed down the leg side, so he'll have to bowl that again
touch fuller, at middle and leg, defended...Boult has been a touch short in this first spell
over the wicket, full at off stump, forced towards mid-off, the bat face twisted a little
a cutter, on the stumps, knocked behind square on the leg side
a length ball outside off is chopped down to third man
dabbed to backward point
fuller, he drives to drive expansively through the off side but loses his shape on the shot
full at off stump, push-and-run towards mid-off is on the edge of the circle
gets this fuller, outside off, 137kph, driven without perfect timing to mid-off
shorter, outside off, he tries to drag a pull through the leg side but finds square leg
that's a lovely shot, another drive on the up through the covers. Just eased forward into the ball
back of a length outside off, cut into the ground and it bounces up to point
a fuller delivery, pushed onto leg stump, clipped off the pads to deep square
good length, angled across outside off, left alone
on leg stump, glances off the pad to short fine leg
a shorter ball on middle and off, rolls his wrists on the pull to deep square
full outside off, shape away from the right hander, left alone
short of a length outside off, that's timed magnificently off the back foot through the covers
better delivery, tight to off stump, defended
tries to drive again off the back foot, the ball perhaps a touch fuller than he thought, takes the outside edge, well wide of slip, to third man
starts short outside off, he won't want to stay they, and gets carted over backward point as du Plessis doesn't even try to keep the ball down
short again, this time he picks out cover
a touch fuller, outside off, 137kph, driven to cover
short of a length, on off stump and shapes back in at du Plessis, angled down to third man
back of a length, angled across de Kock who opens the face and guides it behind point...Taylor gets a hand on it at a wide gully
short outside off, slapped to cover...not the most reassuring of starts from Neesham from a New Zealand point of view
on off stump, 119kph, hint of a leading edge as this runs into the covers
very full, a hint of swing, du Plessis nearly closed the face too early
angled into the pads, deflects behind square...South Africa reach 50
short outside off, width as well, cut through the covers but there's a sweeper out now
through him! De Grandhomme has done it. A full delivery, nips back beautifully off the seam and defeats du Plessis' flat-footed drive. Through a huge gate.
back of a length, more seam movement, comes back at Duminy, beats the inside edge and takes him on the back leg
short outside off, played out to the cover sweeper
full outside off, left alone, decent pace at 141kph
pushed across wider, that must have been close to being called wide
short ball, Duminy is beaten as he goes for the pull, scoots over the top edge
back of a length, opens the face and steers through backward point to third man
good delivery, a yorker at off stump, 141kph, dug out back to the bowler
a forcing shot off the back foot which runs to the leg side
full at middle and off, driven to cover
back of a length, straight, played to the leg side
a bit of nibble for de Grandhomme, a full length at middle and off, he plays across the front pad a touch
full at off stump, 123kph, pushed to the off-side ring
tight to the stumps, pushed back to the pitch...excellent from CDG as he gets through a maiden
full, down the leg side, 142kph, called wide
driven to mid-on
finds the gap this time, with a wonderful shot, comes forward and drives straight of mid-off down the ground
gets a big stride forward and drives again, this time it comes off a thick inside through square leg
round the wicket, full at off stump, and that's an even better stroke...couldn't have timed this any better, a push through the covers which beats the sweeper
back over the wicket, on leg stump, tucked to long leg
full at middle and off, 139kph, worked into midwicket
tight to off stump, angled to backward point, he thinks of a single but is sent back which is wise
a fuller delivery, brings him forward, runs through the leg side off the inside half of the bat
on off stump, 123kph, defended to mid-off
stretches forward, plays with a slightly angled face to backward point
just short! Almost nabs another. Full outside off, he goes for the drive and almost spoons a catch to point
back of a length, steered down to third man...another very good over from de Grandhomme, needs support at the other end
round the wicket, full outside off, driven to deep cover
dragged down short outside off, swung down the ground, was in the air and not a that far from Williamson
better ball, full on off stump, defended
driven to deep cover
touch short outside off, played square through point and they want two but Neesham is onto it very quickly
low full toss, driven straighter this time, through cover and Southee at long-off can't stop the second
full at leg stump, clipped off his toes to deep square leg
nice deft touch, angled away from off stump fine of third man
driven through the off side, wide of the sweeper
round the wicket, full at off stump, played to the leg side
opens the face down to third man
tries to steer this through point, but can't find the gap
good length at middle stump, forward push to point with the spin
tossed up at off stump, driven to cover
pushed flat on a good length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
drops it short outside off, punched to Neesham at deep cover
angled in, back of a length, makes room and chops it into the off side infield
good length outside off, slight turn away, pushed to sweeper off the back foot
flat on a good length at middle, poked off the front foot to midwicket
good length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
tossed up at off stump, gets under it nicely and lifts it over mid-off who is inside the circle
tossed up outside off, pushed to point
good length outside off, goes right back and turns it behind square
flighted full at leg stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length outside off, clears the front leg and slashes it square on the off side, sweeper has to put in a slide
full on the pads, turned off his boot to deep square
full at off stump, driven towards long-off but extra cover dives to stop that to his left
full at middle stump, steps out and chips it over mid-on, lands in the open space and rolls away slowly towards the boundary. Mid-on pulls it back in
full at leg stump, wants to pick the mid-on area again, but goes too hard with the drive and gets an inside edge onto pad
good length outside off, pushed to point's left
good length at middle, swept to long leg
good length at middle, spins slowly off the pitch and catches the thigh guard en route to short fine
full on the pads, flicked straight to square leg
tossed up down the leg side, offers the back of the bat tries to bunt it behind the keeper, beaten
tossed up outside off and he  goes inside-out again and over mid-off. Good shape, full control
tossed up at off stump, bounces down the track and drives it to long-on
good length at middle, pushed off the back foot to square leg's right
tossed up nicely at off stump, driven to long-on
flighted at middle stump, punched to long-on
good length at middle, goes back and turns it through square leg
drops it flat and short outside off, chopped late to pick up an easy two
beautiful bowling. Throws it up nice and high at middle stump, he goes down the track, isn't to the pitch and in the end has to try and reach it with one hand as it sneaks through between bat and pad
full at middle stump, defended into the leg side
full at middle stump, wants to push this to long-on, but midwicket puts in a full length dive and gets in the way

drops it short outside off, deep cover is very square and he punches this in front of him .Southee runs backwards from covers and tries to parry this in, but the momentum pushes it forward and to the side, into the boundary. Fifty for de Kock
full on the pads, flicked through square leg
full at off stump, driven to deep cover
back of a length outside off, soft-handed push in front of point
tossed up outside off, driven sweetly past cover but sweeper is straight enough and it goes straight to him
back of a length outside off, enough time to hang back and slap it behind square
arm ball at middle, makes room to punch but has to check his shot
good length in the corridor, waits for it and pushes it to sweeper
good length at middle stump, pushed through midwicket
pushed flat at off stump, mistimed punch off the back foot to cover
back of a length at off stump, carves it with ease to sweeper's left
short and wide, cut straight to point
short ball at middle stump, pulls it away comfortably to fine leg
short and wide, cut in front of square to sweeper cover

big wicket, gifted carelessly. Good length, gives him the charge, gets followed down the leg side, wants to slog this on the up but it's the lower inside half of the bat and carries comfortably to deep square leg. Needless shot
back of a length at middle, skips up, gets on his toes and punches it through midwicket
overpitched on the pads, and flicked away to Sodhi's right at fine leg. Boult throws a nice hospitality package first up
good length at off stump, grips in the pitch and climbs slightly, but he negotiates it nicely and pushes to covers
good length at middle, spins back and catches him on the thigh as he tries to glance it
back of a length outside off, punched straight to covers
good length outside off, steps out premeditatedly and has to stretch far to cover the line with his leg and push it back to the bowler
short and wide, gets away as the cut is straight to extra cover
good length outside off, opens the face and pushes through point
full outside off, cover drive straight to he fielder
back of a length outside off, turned down to third man
back of a length at the off stump defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, gets behind the line and defends with the full face
back of a length outside off, punched to deep cover
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
full at off stump, driven to cover
back of a length at middle stump, sits up nicely and he rocks back and lifts it over mid-on
full outside off, premeditated sweep catches him outside the line and it's a negative on that raucous appeal
flight and drift, full at off stump, driven to cover
full at off stump, holds it's angle and gets the inside half of the bat and goes back to the bowler as he tries to drive it to long-off
good length outside off, opens the face and slices to deep cover
short and wide, places the cut square and deep cover has to get across
low full toss at off stump, driven to long-off
tossed up at middle stump, driven to long-on
drops short at off stump, gets deep in the crease and middles the pull shot to deep midwicket
googly, starts short outside off, spins further, Miller hasn't picked it and wants to make room, only ends up making too much and is beaten
good length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length at leg stump, pushes it softly between and in front of deep square and deep midwicket
in the blockhole at middle stump, squeezes it out to deep cover
good length at middle stump, pushed to square leg
short and wide, cut straight to sweeper cover
back of a length at middle, pushed off the back foot through midwicket
full outside off, sliced through point
good length, pitches outside off and turns in sharply to get the inside edge on that clueless push forward from Miller. He's not picking it
good length at off, turns away, hangs back, punches to sweeper
full at middle stump, punched to long-on
good length outside off, goes back and pushes into the leg side against the very minimal turn
short and wide, cut to sweeper cover
good length outside off, pushed straight to point on the up
back of a length in the corridor, turned down to third man
short and wide, runs it down to third man
full at middle, pushed to mid-on
good length, angled down the leg side, catches the thigh guard and trickles past Latham
good length outside off, leaves it alone
back of a length at middle, punched to midwicket off the back foot
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
good length at middle, goes back and glances to square leg
good length outside off, pushed tentatively to cover
full at middle stump, leans in and turns it to deep midwicket
short and wide, slapped to deep cover
good length at middle stump, glanced straight to square leg
full on the pads, flicks it to deep square leg's right and sprints back for the second
effortless. Full at middle, holds his shape and punches it past mid-on
good length at middle stump, pushes it out to deep square and that's their half-century stand
short and angled across him, springs back and nails the pull shot like it's the only shot he's ever learned. Amazing reflexes. But only a single to deep square
full and tailing into the pads, pushed to deep square
short at middle and it's that reflex pull shot again, seems to get it out of the middle all the time, but straight to the fielder once more
tossed up at middle stump, driven to long-off
googly, good length on the pad, pushed meekly to square leg

drops it short, he goes for the pull, inside edge onto the boot, Latham has dived at it and claimed a catch, it looks like.They've sent that to the third umpire. That will be not out. It's a bump ball.
back of a length outside off, spins back in and he jams it off the back foot to point
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
tossed up at off stump, comfortably driven past the bowler to long-off
good length at off stump, holds his shape and punches to deep cover
short and spinning into him from outside off, chopped to short third man
full at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
full outside off, goes for the reverse sweep, gets good speed as he hits it on its head and gets it past short third
tossed up outside off, jumps out, converts it into a full toss, drives straight to cover
full at middle stump, punched to long-on
good length, pitches on leg stump and turns further
full outside middle, he goes slow and murders this sweep shot, no one moved
tossed up outside off, turned wide of long-on with the turn
back of  a length on the pads, worked away straight to square leg
gone! He picked the googly here, and tried to run it past Latham but got a thin edge on it and Latham snapped it up
good length outside off, backs away to make room and is beaten as he pushes nervously at it
tossed up at off stump and he's gone for a slog. Mid-on is up so he's safe, but that was a panic shot
tossed up wide outside off stump, driven to sweeper
good length outside off, makes room and is constantly moving away from the ball as he pushes this past slip
good length outside off, pushed down to long-off
full outside off, driven back to the bowler on the bounce
full and flat at off stump, pushed back to the bowler, full face
back of a length outside off, chopped to deep cover
bouncer at middle stump and he's happy to duck under it
good length at middle stump, whipped to midwicket

got him! Takes on the bouncer this time and he's under-edged it! Rolled his fingers at the bouncer outside off, through the shot slightly early, takes a feather off the bottom and Latham grabs it low to his front
good length at middle, shoveled away to Taylor at midwicket and a direct hit at the non-strikers would've been close
what a beauty. Good length outside off, rolled his fingers, cuts away and sneaks under his bat
back of a length, angled into the corridor, chopped down to third man
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
good length outside off, pushes with his hands, away from to body, straight to the fielder
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
good length at middle stump, opens up and drives it long-off
back of a length outside off, dabbed to short third man
full at off stump, driven to cover
back of a length outside off, squeezed into the off side
bouncer angled into him, not in full control of the hook shot, slight top edge but enough bat to take it fine
back of a length at middle stump, punched back to the bowler
good length outside off, swatted across the line to mid-on's right
short at middle, hangs back and absolutely smashes this pull shot in front of square off the front foot

back of a length at the pads, tries to whip this through the leg side, it's a leading edge  that goes to cover on the bounce, Morris has anticipated this ball to fly into the leg side and has taken off, only to be caught well short of the crease at the non-strikers as Dean Brownlie underams and gets a direct hit...in fact, it was a backhand flick. Incredible.
full at off stump, flicked straight to square leg
back of a length at off, pushed to cover
full and wide, driven out to cover
gone! He's played all around it. good length at off stump, wants to whip it into the leg side, trapped in front and it's a straightforward decision. No thoughts of a review there
short and wide, backs away and cuts to deep point
good length at off, waits for the spin and bounce and runs it to short third man's left off the face of the bat
bouncer at middle stump from around the wicket, ducks under it
good length, angled in at the off stump, pushed to point
full outside off, shapes to drive this expansively, it sneaks under his bat
full at off stump, dug out and straight back at the bowler
low full toss outside off, driven straight to cover
full and angled into the pads, gets enough bat to whip it fine
tossed up wide outside off, leans into it and hits it uppishly. Boult has run forward and to his left at long-off, seems to have taken a good catch, but has dropped it as he hit the ground. Unlucky.
good length outside off, backs away and contorts as he opens the face and gets it through where slip would've been
good length at off stump, front foot defence
good length outside off, goes for the reverse sweep, cops it on the body as it bounces and turns too much for that shot
low full toss on the pads, flicked to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, a little shimmy before punching it to long-off
googly, short and wide, goes for the pull against the turn, bounces into the leg side
tossed up outside off, gets under it and bludgeons it inside-out over the extra cover boundary for the first six of the game
good length at middle, pushed to long-on off the back foot
dropped short outside off, goes back and pulls it to the right of deep midwicket
short and wide, cuts it to sweeper cover
low full toss at off stump, gives the charge and  drives it to deep cover
back of a length outside off, hangs back and puts in a clean swing to club it flat over the midwicket boundary
yorker outside off, tries to chop it fine through third man gets an inside edge that goes past Latham instead!
short ball angled down the leg side
yorker down the leg side, goes past his flick
yorker outside off, dug out through the covers
so close! Perfect yorker, tails in at off stump and somehow bounces past it
yorker at leg stump, makes room and squeezes it to mid-off
good length at off stump, pushed to cover off the front foot
googly, tossed up outside off, tries to go over long-on and is beaten
googly, short and wide, cut straight to point and a fumble allows the single
short and on the pads, pulls it nicely, but Boult puts in a great dive to his right at deep suare to prevent a boundary
good length outside off, driven to deep cover
googly, short and wide, slaps it straight to extra cover
yorker that flirts with the wide marker, but Pretorious has used his reach to chop this through second slip for four. Brilliant shot
low full toss at middle stump, tails in sligthtly and he lifts this back over his partner's head and it evades Santner's dive after running 10 yards to his left at long-on
overpitched outside off, driven powerfully out to sweeper, who sends in a good throw, but they've beaten it for the second run
99 kph, leg cutter, short and well wide
back of a length on the pads, glanced to deep square leg
yorker outside off, throws his hands at it and is beaten
full on the pads, punched to long-on
nails the yorker at middle stump, he can't do anything with that and bunts it back to the bowler
yorker at leg stump, jams it out to long-on

yorker at middle stump, he backs away to look for the off side gaps but can only squeeze it out to third man. It's a <b>fifty for Pretorious and he will remember it for a long time no matter what the result
yorker at leg stump, looks to slog this, inside edge rolls to square leg's left and they come back for a second
another yorker at leg stump, you can see why he went for all that money in the auction. Punched down to long-on

got him! Boult, you beauty! Misses the yorker marginally, he steps out and the full toss gets higher than it would've been for him, and it crashes into the off stump. Is that the match for New Zealand? What a fantastic knock by Pretorious, South Africa have no business being in this game right now, this is all him
yorker at the off stump, drives it to extra cover, bit of confusion as they don't know whether to go for the run - they decide not to
yorker outside off, carved straight to extra cover
another yorker, wide outside off, thick edge down to third man and no run
...it doesn't! This is phenomenal death overs bowling. As professional as it can get. Another yorker outside off, dug out to cover
attempted yorker outside off, after four balls, he goes for the reverse ramp and converts it into a full toss that he gets past the keeper

overpithched at leg stump, backs away and whacks it straight back over the umpire....<b>and that's the match. 10 consecutive balls in the blockhole to win by six runs - they showed up when it mattered, those seniors.
